casebody.data:
Jane and John DOE, et al.
v.
ALTERNATIVE MEDICINE MARYLAND, LLC, et al. No. 98, Sept. Term, 2016 Court of Appeals of Maryland. July 28, 2017 Argued by Arnold M. Weiner, Michael D. Berman (Barry L. Gogel, Rifkin Weiner Livingston LLC, Baltimore, MD; Alan M. Rifiin, Rifkin Weiner Livingston LLC, Annapolis, MD; Paul D. Bekman, Bekman, Marder & Adkins, LLC, Baltimore, MD; Robert Schulman, Schulman, Hershfield & Gilden, P.A., Baltimore, MD; Ira T. Kasdan, Joseph D. Wilson and Bezalel A. Stern, Kelley Drye & Warren LLP, Washington, DC; Gary R. Jones, Danielle M. Vranian, Baxter Baker, Sidle, Conn & Jones, P.A., Baltimore, MD; Bruce L. Marcus, Sydney M. Patterson, MarcusBonsib, LLC, Greenbelt, MD), on briefs, for Appellants. Argued by Julia Doyle Bernhardt, Asst. Atty. Gen. (Heather B. Nelson, Asst. Atty. Gen., Brian E. Frosh, Atty. Gen. of Maryland, Baltimore, MD), for Appellees. Byron B. Warnken (Warnken, LLC, Pikesville, MD); Brian S. Brown (Brown & Barron, LLC, Baltimore, MD; John A. Pica, Jr., John Pica & Associates, Inc., Annapolis, MD) on brief, for Appellees. Argued before Barbera, C.J., Greene, McDonald, Watts, Hotten, Getty, Alan M. Wilne, (Senior Judge, Specially Assigned), JJ. PER CURIAM ORDER

For reasons to be stated in an opinion later to be filed, it is this 28th day of July, 2017

ORDERED, by the Court of Appeals of Maryland, that the orders of the Circuit Court for Baltimore City denying intervention to Holistic Industries, LLC, Curio Cultivation, LLC, ForwardGro, LLC, SunMed Growers, LLC, Doctor's Orders Maryland, LLC, Green Leaf Medical, LLC, Kind Therapeutics, USA, LLC, and Temescal Wellness of MD, LLC ("Growers") be, and they are hereby reversed, and the case is remanded to that Court with instruction to grant intervention as of right with respect to the aforementioned Growers, pursuant to Maryland Rules 2-211 and 2-214(a) and Section 3-405(a)(1) of the Courts and Judicial Proceedings Article ; and it is further ORDERED, that the orders of the Circuit Court for Baltimore City denying intervention to Jane and John Doe ("Patients") be, and they are hereby affirmed; and it is further

ORDERED, that the orders of the Circuit Court for Baltimore City denying intervention to the Coalition for Patient Medicinal Access, LLC and Maryland Wholesale Medical Cannabis Trade Association be, and they are hereby affirmed; and it is further

ORDERED, that this case is remanded to the Circuit Court for Baltimore City for further proceedings including determination of the issue of laches raised in this appeal, this Court having determined that it will not address that issue in this appeal; and it is further

ORDERED, that the stay issued by this Court of June 2, 2017 be, and it is hereby lifted; and it is further

ORDERED, that the costs in this Court and in the Court of Special Appeals to be paid 50% by Alternative Medicine Maryland, LLC, 25% by Coalition for Patient Medicinal Access, LLC and 25% by Maryland Wholesale Medical Cannabis Trade Association. Mandate to be issued forthwith.
